result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

per email from Defense Counsel requesting this case be placed on the speedy disposition calendar before Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Branch 37 notified and confirmed hearing date. New date confirmed with both parties. 
Case placed on Branch 37 calendar for a Plea and Sentencing November 17, 2022 at 2:00pm.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

ADOURNED OFF THE RECORD. 
Defendant Martesse A Johnson not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Martesse A Johnson. 
 Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
Defense counsel request an adjournment. Granted by the Court. 
Case remans calendared in Branch 19 and ordered matter adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Martesse A Johnson not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received discovery and an offer and is requesting a plea and sentencing date.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Martesse Antonio Johnson not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail hearing heard and DENIED by the Court.  Case is adjourned for a scheduling conference in Br 45.  mn  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Martesse A Johnson in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Martesse A Johnson in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEARD BY VIDEO.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defence wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am. Date given by Judge Kies Clerk.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Paul E.

Defendant Martesse A Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Martesse A Johnson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Martesse A Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
